intro: Cyclobalanopsis kontumensis, commonly known as Kontum's evergreen oak, is a rare and endemic tree species found in the Central Highlands of Vietnam. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts, and is characterized by its hard, durable wood. The plant has broad,革质 (leathery) leaves that are typically elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. It produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one or two seeds, typical of the genus Cyclobalanopsis. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to forest biodiversity and soil stability.
